structure.unit: A AUTOMATED MOTOR VEHICLE REGISTRATION SYSTEM

law.text:
There shall be paid for issuing and processing documents required by this chapter fees according to the following schedule:
Each application for a certificate of title shall be nine dollars ($9), of which the county clerk shall retain six dollars ($6) and the Transportation Cabinet shall receive three dollars ($3).
Each application for a replacement or corrected certificate of title shall be six dollars ($6), of which the county clerk shall retain four dollars ($4) and the Transportation Cabinet shall receive two dollars ($2). If a corrected certificate must be issued because of an error of the county clerk or the Department of Vehicle Regulation, there shall be no charge.
Each application for a speed title shall be twenty-five dollars ($25), of which the county clerk shall retain five dollars ($5) and the Transportation Cabinet shall receive twenty dollars ($20).
Each application for a certificate of title for an all-terrain vehicle shall be fifteen dollars ($15), of which the county clerk shall retain six dollars ($6) and the Transportation Cabinet shall receive nine dollars ($9).
Each application for a replacement or corrected certificate of title for an all-terrain vehicle shall be ten dollars ($10), of which the county clerk shall retain four dollars ($4) and the Transportation Cabinet shall receive six dollars ($6). If a corrected certificate must be issued because of an error of the county clerk or the Department of Vehicle Regulation, there shall be no charge.
law.history: Amended 2009 Ky. Acts ch. 64, sec. 3, effective June 25, 2009. -- Amended 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 255, sec. 11, effective January 1, 2007. -- Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 35, sec. 3, effective July 15, 1996. -- Amended 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 428, sec. 34, effective July 15, 1994. -- Created 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 164, sec. 23, effective July 15, 1982.
